intro: Diplazium mauianum, commonly known as the New Zealand shield fern, is a species of evergreen fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. Its rhizomes are creeping and can form dense colonies, contributing to its ability to thrive in various habitats. The fronds are leathery and have a rough texture, with spores produced on the undersides of the leaves.
